title: **Isolation of human peripheral blood mononuclear cells \(PBMC) and CD4+ T cells**

body.body: Transfer blood in heparin vacutainer tubes into 50 ml BLUE MAXTM BD Falcon tube
Carefully layer 30 ml diluted blood over 12ml of Isolymph \(do not allow layers to mix)
Centrifuge for 30 min \(1,800 rpm) at room temperature.
Harvest buffy coat layer \(whitish inter-phase layer containing PBMC) \(~2-5 ml)
Transferred to fresh 50 ml Falcon tube and bring to 50 ml with PBS
Wash twice in PBS by centrifugation for 10 min in 1,200 rpm at 4 °C
Suspend pellet in 5 ml cold complete medium and count cells in hemacytometer.
15-20 ml of buffy coat yields >50×10<sup>6</sup> buffy coat cells
Isolate CD4+ T cells from buffy coat with Rosette Sep kit as suggested by manufacturer.

title: **Expansion of Th17 cells in human PBMC by IL-2**

body.body: Prepare fresh culture medium containing requisite antibiotics and serum
Re-suspend PBMC or purified CD4+ T cells \(1 X 106 per ml) in presence or absence of IL-2 \(100 u/ml), TGF-β1, IL-6 or IL-23 at 10 ng/ml or IFN-γ at 100 U/ ml.
Culture cells in 24 well plate \(2 ml per well) at 37 °C for 4 days in 5% CO<sub>2</sub>
Harvest culture supernatants \(0.5 ml/well) for ELISA.
Multiplex ELISA was performed using Pierce Search Light Technology \(Pierce Boston Technology, Woburn, MA).
Harvest cells by pipetting gently up and down with 2 ml Serological pipette
Transfer to 15 ml tubes and centrifuge at 1200 RPM \(Sorvall Legend RT) for 10 min.
Activate PBMC or CD4+ T cells in the presence or absence of IL-2 for 4 days
Stimulate cultures with PMA \(20 ng/ml) and Ionomycin \(1 mm) for 4 h
Terminate the reaction by addition of Golgistop to cultures for 1 additional hour
Transfer cells into 15 ml of SARSTEDT tubes and wash cells twice in FACS buffer
Suspend cells in FACS buffer \(1-2×10<sup>6</sup>/ml)
Transfer 1 ml aliquots \(1-2×10<sup>6</sup>) into separate 5 ml Falcon tubes
Centrifuge for 1,200 rpm for 10 min.
Perform intracellular staining using BD Cytofix/Cytoperm kit as suggested by manufacturer
Subject stained cells to FACS analysis immediately or within 48 h \(keep cells at 4 °C). In our lab, data collection was with FACSCalibur and analyzed using FLOWJO analysis software.
Homogenize samples in 1 ml of TRIZoL reagent per 50-100mg of tissue \(<15 ml)
Transfer to Nalgene tubes and incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Add 0.25 ml of chloroform per 1 ml of TRIZoL reagent.
Shake vigorously by hand or vortex for 15 seconds.
Incubate at room temperature for 2-3 minutes.
Centrifuge at 12,000 g \(about 9,000 rpm on SV600) for 15 min at 4 °C.
Transfer aqueous phase to fresh Nalgene tubes.
Add equal volume of isopropyl alcohol.
Mix well and incubate samples at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Centrifuge at 12,000 g for 10 minutes at 2-8 °C.
Discard supernatant and add 1 ml of 75% ETOH to pellet.
Using a 2 ml pipette, scrape the RNA pellet away from tube into the ETOH.
Transfer ETOH/RNA mixture to fresh 1.5 ml eppendorf tube.
Rinse nalgene tube with more 75% ETOH and transfer to the eppendorf tube.
Bring the final volume of RNA/ETOH sample to 1.5 ml with 75% ETOH
Centrifuge at max speed in refrigerated microfuge for 10 minute
Discard supernatant and add 500 µl 75% ETOH
Centrifuge at 10,000 rpm in refrigerated microfuge for 5 minute
Pulse the sample and using P100 pipette carefully remove residual ETOH.
Air-dry RNA pellet for 15 minutes.
Redissolve RNA in DEPC treated water and store in aliquots at -70 °C.
Determine RNA concentration using a spectrophotometer.

To 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube add the following \(all RNA grade):


RNA =X µl


10X Buffer =50 µl


DNAse I =1 µl


DEPC Water ==>500µl
Digest for 20 minutes at 37 °C.
Add 30 µl 20 mM EDTA \(RNA grade) and heat at 95 °C for 5 mins.
Phenol/chloroform extraction \(1x): add 500 µl \(Phenol/chloroform
Vortex \(1 minute) and centrifuge for 5 minutes at 14,000 rpm \(RT).
Transfer aqueous phase \(top) to another RNAse-free 1.5 ml tube.
Chloroform extraction: Add 400 µl of chloroform \(with isoamyl alcohol)
Vortex \(1 minute) and centrifuge for 5 minutes at 14,000 rpm \(RT).
Transfer aqueous phase \(top) to another RNAse-free 1.5 ml tube.
Determine the volume of sample
Precipitate by adding 1/9 volume of 3 M NaOAc, pH 5.2.
Add 2 volumes cold absolute \(95-100%) alcohol
Incubate on dry ice \(or -70 °C) for 15 minutes.
Centrifuge at 4 °C, 14,000 rpm for 15 minutes.
Remove supernatant and add 500 µl of ice-cold 75% EtOH.
Incubate for 5 minutes at RT.
Centrifuge at 4 °C, 14,000 rpm for 5 minutes.
Remove supernatant and add 500 µl of ice-cold 75% EtOH.
Incubate for 5 minutes at RT.
Centrifuge at 4 °C, 14,000 rpm for 5 minutes.
Remove supernatant
Spin for 30 seconds
Remove supernatant with 100 µl pipetteman
Air dry for 15 minutes.
Suspend in DEPC water.

title: **First Strand cDNA Synthesis**
body: _Use only DEPC-treated H<sub>2</sub>O, RNase-free tubes, and ART tips_

body.body: Wipe down lab bench and pipetteman with 10% H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2</sub> and change gloves frequently
Mix all components briefly and spin down.
Preset heat blocks or thermocycler to 37 °C, 50 °C and 70 °C, respectively
Into a 0.5 ml microcentrifuge tube add 27.5 µl RNA \(1-10 µg)
Add 2.5 µl Oligo\(dT) to each tube
Incubate mixture at 70 °C for 10 minutes
Quench on ice for 1 minute and leave on ice

Add the following reagents in the following order:


5 X First Strand buffer 10 µl


a. M DTT 5.0 µl


10 mM dNTP 2.5 µl


RNAse out 1.0 µl
Incubate for 2 minutes at 50 °C
Add 2.5 µl Superscript III \(Invitrogen; Catalog # 18080-093)
Mix gently by tapping tubes, pulse
Incubate at 50 °C for 60 minutes

title: **Note**
body: : Up to this point, be extremely careful to prevent RNase contamination. For preparation of more than 5 RNA samples, Superscript can be added together with the other reagents

body.body: Incubate at 70 °C for 15 minutes to terminate reaction
Incubate tubes at 37 °C for 2 minutes
Add 1.0 µl \(3.5 units) of RNase H, mix gently by tapping tubes
Incubate at 37 °C for 30 minutes
Then at 95 °C for 5 minutes
Pulse samples by brief centrifugation
Add 6 µl of 4 M LiCl to each tube, vortex and pulse
Add 150 µl of cold \(-20°C) absolute EtOH and vortex
Freeze in dry ice for 30 minutes
Spin at 14,000 rpm for 15 minutes and remove supernatant
Add 150 µl of cold 75% EtOH
Spin for 15 minutes as above and remove supernatant
Air-Dry for 15 minutes
Suspend pellet in 50 µl of DEPC-treated H2O
Incubate at 70 °C, 10 minutes: to completely dissolve the pellet
Save 0.5-1.0 µl for cDNA quantification
Store at -20 °C

title: **Note**
body: : Verify that all RNA preparations are of high quality by spectrophotometry \(optical density at 260 Angstrom: >1.9) and

body.body: Verify integrity of the RNA by Formamide electrophoresis using 1.5-2.0 µg RNA \(use mini-gel apparatus). Examine intensity of 18S and 28S ribosomal RNA.

For RT-PCR, incubate samples at 95 °C for 10 min to activate the AmpliTaq Gold and carry out amplification for 30-35 cycles of 30 s each at 95 °C, 60 °C, and 72 °C. Follow this by a final 10-min extension at 72 °C. PCR primers used span at least an intron.

Perform real-time 5’-nuclease fluorogenic RT-PCR analysis on an ABI 7500 real-time PCR System using Taqman primer/probe sets \(ABI) and PCR parameters as recommended for TaqMan Universal PCR master mix kit \(PE Biosystems). Calculate relative levels of gene expression by extrapolation from standard curves generated using purified human IL-17 cDNA fragments. Standard curves from our lab showed excellent linearity, indicating precise quantitative relationship between cDNA copy number and fluorescence intensity within the dynamic range of the assay.
Normalise the mRNA expression levels to the levels of ACTB \(encoding β-actin) and/or GAPDH housekeeping genes
